materials.raw_text:
B (Boron) - 20 g 
 C (Carbon) - 10 g 
 Co (Cobalt) - 5 g 
 Ni (Nickel) - 5 g 
 Tm (Thulium) - 1 g

sourcing.instructions:
B (Boron) - Chemical suppliers or online marketplaces. 
 C (Carbon) - Graphite powder available at art supply stores or chemical suppliers. 
 Co (Cobalt) - Metal suppliers or specialized chemical vendors. 
 Ni (Nickel) - Metal suppliers or hardware stores. 
 Tm (Thulium) - Rare earth metal suppliers or specialized online chemical stores.
steps: B (Boron) - Chemical suppliers or online marketplaces.
C (Carbon) - Graphite powder available at art supply stores or chemical suppliers.
Co (Cobalt) - Metal suppliers or specialized chemical vendors.
Ni (Nickel) - Metal suppliers or hardware stores.
Tm (Thulium) - Rare earth metal suppliers or specialized online chemical stores.
1. Measure out 20 g of Boron powder.
2. Measure out 10 g of Carbon powder.
3. Measure out 5 g of Cobalt powder.
4. Measure out 5 g of Nickel powder.
5. Measure out 1 g of Thulium powder.
6. In a clean mixing container, combine all measured powders thoroughly to ensure an even distribution.
preparation.raw_text:
1. Measure out 20 g of Boron powder. 
 2. Measure out 10 g of Carbon powder. 
 3. Measure out 5 g of Cobalt powder. 
 4. Measure out 5 g of Nickel powder. 
 5. Measure out 1 g of Thulium powder. 
 6. In a clean mixing container, combine all measured powders thoroughly to ensure an even distribution.

steps: 1. Preheat a furnace to 1200 °C.
2. Place the mixed powders into a suitable crucible.
3. Insert the crucible into the furnace and maintain the temperature for 2 hours to facilitate proper bonding and reaction of materials.
heating.raw_text:
1. Preheat a furnace to 1200 °C. 
 2. Place the mixed powders into a suitable crucible. 
 3. Insert the crucible into the furnace and maintain the temperature for 2 hours to facilitate proper bonding and reaction of materials.

steps: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down to room temperature naturally (approximately 4-6 hours).
2. Do not open the furnace until it has fully cooled to prevent thermal shock to the material.
cooling.raw_text:
1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down to room temperature naturally (approximately 4-6 hours). 
 2. Do not open the furnace until it has fully cooled to prevent thermal shock to the material.

steps: 1. Remove the solidified sample from the crucible.
2. Use a diamond grinding wheel to grind the edges to achieve the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches.
3. Inspect the surface for any rough spots and sand them down with fine-grit sandpaper.
4. Optionally, apply a sealing coat to enhance surface durability and prevent oxidation.
post_processing.raw_text:
1. Remove the solidified sample from the crucible. 
 2. Use a diamond grinding wheel to grind the edges to achieve the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 
 3. Inspect the surface for any rough spots and sand them down with fine-grit sandpaper. 
 4. Optionally, apply a sealing coat to enhance surface durability and prevent oxidation.
